intro: Machaeranthera pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf false sunflower, is a small flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Machaeranthera pygmaea is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
